Question: All of the following are tools & techniques of Manage Stakeholder Expectations except:
Note: [Qno: PML_111] >> Stakeholder analysis is Tool and Technique of Identify Stakeholder process

Question: Which of the following is an input to Distribute Information?
Note: [Qno: PML_114] >> In communication management knowledge area Project Charter is input & Stakeholder register is output of identify stakeholders. Change request is input only to one process in PMBoK.

Question: Effective stakeholder management includes all of the following project elements except:
Note: [Qno: PML_120] >> As project manager you need to know how frequent the information need to be made available. Saying frequent is not sufficient, neither it guarantees the effective stakeholder management.

Question: Of the following management skills, which will a project manager use most?
Note: [Qno: PML_125] >> An effective project manager’s 90 % time goes in communication activities

Question: You are working with a team of 10 engineers and 2 team leaders. In the mid of project two test engineers joins your project. How many new communication channel opened because of this event?
Note:
[Qno: PML_144] >> Initial team size=13 and number of communication channel = n*(n-1)/2 = 13*12/2= 78
Modified team size = 15 and number of total communication channels in new team = 15*14/2 = 105
New communication channels = # of Channels in New Team- # of Channels in Old Team = 105- 78 =27

Question: You have been assigned as a project manager into a very large project. There are many obstacles in the project and controversy on already delivered items. There are 60 keys stakeholder on this project representing. With this many stakeholders, what challenge will be the most difficult for the project’s success?
Note: [Qno: PML_178] >> 1, 2, 4 can be managed up to a certain extend with well defined processes. Managing stakeholder expectation needs strong interpersonal, leadership skills.

Answers: Coordinating communication between the project manager, the project team, and the project stakeholders.

Question: You are the project manager of a project where you work with 15 other team members, one sponsor, and three managers who will contribute significantly to your project. How many communication are there between stakeholders in your project?
Note: [Qno: PML_233] >> Total team is 20 member team including project manager.

Question: You are working on a government project where various departments are stakeholders. One of your responsibility is to identify that how stakeholders are likely to react in various situation. Based on this you need to develop strategy to gain their support. What tool you would use for this?
The first meeting of the project when you address all stakeholders and outline about how everyone will communicate as the project progress is called ….
Who is responsible on your project to decide about what communication method need to be used, how and when?
Video conferencing tool  where CEO can address the project team and address only selected queries. This is an example of
You published recent project report on your project portal. This information can be used by stakeholder at their own pace. This is an example of -----
How does a project management team stay in touch with the work and the attitudes of project team members

Answers: By hiring soft skill expert in project team
Use functional manager to communicate with team members

Question: You have been assigned a project manager for an information security project. This project will help the organization is big way but since the beginning your are facing huge resistance from the people because their way of working will change once this project is complete. What shall you do?
Note: [Qno: PML_543] >> PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, pages 215 and 233 (9.2.3.4).

Answers: Develop a Responsibility assignment matrix (RAM) based on RACI and inform people about this.
Develop an organization diagram which does not allow and encourage any unofficial discussion which can be fatal for project.
Do not talk to these stakeholders too much at this time, instead create Faits accomplis, which will later force the stakeholders to support the project due to a lack of alternatives for them.
Schedule a meeting with these stakeholders to present the project, discuss and establish ground rules, ensure their involvement and identify initial personal and organizational issues.

Question: What should you focus on when managing the stakeholders of your project?
Which is NOT a type of project review meeting?
What is not the main purpose of a final Project report?
Note: [Qno: PML_687] >> Preparing acceptance of the final product, service or result is done as a part of verify scope process. See PMBOK(r) Guide, 4th Edition, page 102

Answers: Making stakeholders aware that the project has been closed out.
Acknowledging what has been done and achieved by all contributors.
Preparing acceptance of the final product, service or result.
If a project has been cancelled before completion: Explaining the causes.

Question: Which is not included in Performance improvements :
Note: [Qno: PML_836] >> Overtime worked is not the performance improvement in project

Answers: Improvements in amount of overtime worked

Question: When do you perform stakeholder analysis?
Note: [Qno: PML_1139] >> Identify Stakeholders is one of the processes in the Communications Management knowledge area. Stakeholder Analysis is one of the tools and techniques of the Identify Stakeholders process. The goal of stakeholder analysis is to write down the needs of your stakeholders.

Answers: When creating the project management plan
When putting changes through change control
When managing communications on your project

Question: You are working as project manager on a IT project. Late in the project, client demands a big change. You did the assessment of the impact of the change and informs the client that how much time and money it will cost. But the client says that he doesn’t have the time or budget to allow the change. What is the BEST way for you to handle this situation?

Answers: Plan a senior managers’ meet with the client to explain the situation
Hold a meeting with the client to figure out why he is asking for the change
Stop the work, right there because working after this will be waste of time and money (customer may not accept it)
Have the client find more money for the budget

Question: You are working on a project with 7 engineers, 1 architect. While you are in execution phase 2 more joins your team for quality control activities. How many new communication channel opens.
Note: [Qno: PML_1264] >>  The formula for lines of communication is n x (n-1) / 2. In beginning team size is 9 people it has increased to 11 people. Therefore in beginning there are 36 communication channels, after new member join there are 55 communication channel. Thus 55-36 = 19 new communication channels opens

Question: The stakeholder analysis matrix is part of what process?
Note: [Qno: PML_1383] >> It is part of the Stakeholder Management Strategy which is output of Identify Stakeholders. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 251

Question: What percentage of the message contained in email is actually understood by the recipients?
Note: [Qno: PML_1423] >> Albert Mehrabian showed in his Paralingual studies that only 7% of the message is contained in the words. 38% is contained in the vocal pitch and tone, 55% is contained in the body language is understood by the people.

Question: A variance analysis is used for:
The fundamental difference between Effective communication and Efficient communication means that:
Note: [Qno: PML_1534] >> Effective communication means that the information is provided in the right format, at right time, and with the right impact. Efficient communication means providing only the information that is needed. On most project communication planning is done in early phases of the project therefore to check the efficiency of communication plan one should review it from time to time. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 252

Answers: Effective communications ensure the guaranteed delivery of the communication and Efficient communications provide information to only the stakeholders who need it
Effective communications focus on the fastest communication channel  and Efficient communications focus on the most appropriate communication channel
Effective communications ensure the timeliness and the format of the communications and Efficient communications provide only the information that is needed
Effective communications are required and Efficient communications are optional

Question: The sender of a message is responsible for:

Answers: Ensuring the receiver agrees with the message
Presenting the message in the most agreeable manner

Question: The major purpose of project status reports is to:
Note: [Qno: PML_1897] >> Project status reports are prepared in Report Performance Process and the purpose of this is to organize and summarize the information.

Answers: Inform upper management of the project problems
Organize and summarize the information so that all stakeholders were informed
Inform the client about the changes that have completed
Provide information to management and client

Question: Manage Stakeholders Expectations is a part which of the following knowledge area
In a basic communication model what is not expected?
Note: [Qno: PML_2023] >> Receiver may disagree as well.

Answers: Receiver should agree with the message sent by the sender.
Receiver must decode and reply to the message.
Receiver should send a feedback message to the sender.

Question: You have recently completed the distribute information process. What is output of the this process?
You are managing a project in a foreign country, where you have to pay a fee to a government agencies to get your work done. In this case you should.
Note: [Qno: PML_2056] >> PM has the responsibility to refrain from offering or accepting inappropriate payments, gifts, or other forms of compensation for personal gain. But if it is conforming to the culture and law of that country then do the needful but you inform to your manager & sponsor

Answers: Refuse to pay the fee, because they are bribes and hence unethical
Make a case why fees should be paid to government agencies, and present it to your management
Pay the fee to the government agencies
Offer gifts to the government officials instead of fee to get their support

Question: On your project you are constantly involved in managing stakeholders` expectations to satisfy their needs and resolve issues. In this context, all the following are relevant outputs EXCEPT:
Note: [Qno: PML_2118] >> Communication requirement analysis is tool and technique of plan communication

Question: Which tool is used to compare the difference between the baseline and actual performance determine the cause of variance.
If a customer requests for additional work that is not in the contract, then what type of communication the customer should use?
You have recently sent one status report to your sponsor. What was the purpose of that?

Answers: Get the status from each team member

Question: Phone call and Video Conferencing are
A process in which you identify all people or organizations impacted by the project is

This week you have been assigned trouble project, where schedule is 50% behind the plan and project manager has left the organization. After evaluation, you discovered that the project is running far behind schedule the schedule then reported by previous project manager. However, the sponsor has been told that the project is on schedule. What is the BEST course of action you will take?

Answers: Add new resource to the project and complete the project on schedule.
Show your finding and evaluation to sponsor.
Ask your senior manager to deal with this.
Turn the project back to the previous project manager.

Question: You have been assigned as the project manager in the middle of the project but the customer is not happy with the performance of the project. What is the FIRST thing you should do?

Answers: Under the performance criteria from the project plan and achieve those
Talk to customer and understand his concerns.
Ignore the customer, it is bound to happen sometimes in project lifecycle.
Leave the project and ask your manager to assign another project.

Question: Which of the following communication method is widely used to explain complex problems?
As a project manager, you realize that managing project stakeholder expectations is an important priority. Which statement on project stakeholders is NOT correct?
Note: [Qno: PML_2454] >> Overlooking negative stakeholders can result in an increased difficulty level in your project. Reference: PMBOK(r) Guide Fourth Edition, Page 24

Answers: Stakeholders has varying degree of responsibilities and it keep changing throughout the project life cycle.
Negative stakeholders can be ignored because they are not useful for meeting the project objective.
Government agencies, political parties, trade unions, local citizens can be stakeholders on your project.
Because of conflicting objectives it is very difficult to manage the expectations of stakeholders.

Question: What are the contents of stakeholder register?
Note: [Qno: PML_2482] >>  Reference: PMBOK(r) Guide Fourth Edition, Page Number:243

Answers: Stakeholder interests, involvement, and impact on project success
Their requirements and how to address them
List of all the issues of the stakeholders and responsibility assignment for those issues

Question: Processes required to ensure timely and appropriate generation, collection, dissemination, storage and ultimate disposition of project information are part of
A meeting held to assess project status or progress is called
Except ----- all other are tools and techniques for report performance process
Which process of communication management knowledge does NOT use communication method tool
Note: [Qno: PML_2903] >> While identifying stakeholders you need not to use any communication methods.

Question: Change Log is input to
One of your stakeholder has recently requested a change which you think is not part of the project scope. What shall you do?

Answers: Enter the change in change log, then discuss with stakeholder. If they insist on change then raise a change request and process the same through perform integrated change control
Conduct the impact analysis and ask stakeholder for approval
Ignore it, as these kind of change request keep coming in any project which has progressive elaboration.

Question: The tool ------- is not suitable for generating forecast information.
Process of making relevant information available to project stakeholders as planned is called
The focus of distribute information process is on

Note: [Qno: PML_2971] >> Distribute information is executing process group process and here you may  also have to handle unexpected request like this.

Question: The process of collecting and distributing performance information is called
Which one of the below is not objective of performance reporting
Note: [Qno: PML_2973] >> Report performance is focused on monitoring & controlling activities. This process is responsible for periodically compiling project reports and send to the relevant stakeholders.

Answers: Period collection and analysis of baseline versus actual data

Note: [Qno: PML_2975] >> Report performance is focused on monitoring & controlling activities. This process is responsible for periodically compiling project reports and send to the relevant stakeholders.

Note: [Qno: PML_2979] >> Distribute information process has only one output -Organization Process Assets Updates
